abstract: Spokesman for Republican-led House select committee investigating 2012 terrorist attacks in Benghazi, Libya, counters claims from Hillary Rodham Clinton's staff that agreement has been reached concerning her appearance before committee; primary topic of contention appears to be whether hearings will include investigation into discovery of classified information on private email account Clinton used during her tenure as Secretary of State.
lead_paragraph: A spokesman for Mrs. Clinton’s campaign said she had agreed to testify on Oct. 22, but a committee spokesman said a deal was not done.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MAGGIE HABERMAN
byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Washington, and Maggie Haberman from New York.

headline.main: Aides for Hillary Clinton and Benghazi Committee Dispute Testimony Plan
headline.print_headline: Spat Breaks Out Over Plans for Clinton’s Testimony Before Benghazi Committee

snippet: A spokesman for Mrs. Clinton’s campaign said she had agreed to testify on Oct. 22, but a committee spokesman said a deal was not done....
